meanings.definition: In a manner related to the preparation and dispensing of drugs or medications.
meanings.sent1: The pharmacist mixed the ingredients pharmaceutically to create the medicine.
meanings.sent2: The medication was pharmaceutically prepared by the pharmacy.
meanings.sent3: The doctor joked that the pills were dancing pharmaceutically in the bottle.
meanings.sent4: The healing power of the medicine spread pharmaceutically throughout the body.
meanings.sent5: The effects of the drug were felt pharmaceutically within minutes.

meanings.definition: In a way that pertains to the science and practice of pharmacy.
meanings.sent1: She studied pharmaceutically to become a skilled pharmacist.
meanings.sent2: The pharmacist explained the dosage pharmaceutically to the patient.
meanings.sent3: The pharmacy students laughed as they practiced counting pills pharmaceutically.
meanings.sent4: The knowledge of pharmacy spread pharmaceutically among the students.
meanings.sent5: The importance of following instructions was emphasized pharmaceutically.

meanings.definition: Relating to the production and sale of pharmaceutical drugs.
meanings.sent1: The pharmaceutical company developed a new pharmaceutically advanced drug.
meanings.sent2: The pharmaceutically produced medicine was highly effective.
meanings.sent3: The pharmacist admired the pharmaceutically designed packaging of the medication.
meanings.sent4: The competition in the pharmaceutically industry was fierce.
meanings.sent5: The pharmaceutically manufactured pills were in high demand.
